thread.title: U-15 Mir Iqbal Trophy to be refurbished
thread.title_full: U-15 Mir Iqbal Trophy to be refurbished - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: U-15 Mir Iqbal Trophy to be refurbished
text:
JAIPUR: In a bid to curb the menace of age-fraud, the Sub-Junior National Football Championship is all set for an overhaul.
The U-15 tournament - called the Coca Cola Cup and also the Mir Iqbal Hussain Trophy - played by states so far will, in all likelihood, be made into a school tournament months after its last edition saw champions Jharkhand field five overage players in the final against Goa, resulting in them getting stripped of the title for the infringement.
According to sources, it is sponsors Coca Cola who have been pushing for the revamp and has asked the All India Football Federation (AIFF) to draft a format.
"Yes, such an idea has been mooted and I believe it can only augur well for Indian football," Debabrata Mukherjee, vice-president, marketing and commercial, Coca-Cola India and South West Asia told TOI on Friday.
"Schools will help better combination play and more importantly bring the crowd support which any sport needs to grow. Alma mater is the biggest pride anyone can have," Mukherjee said.
Asked whether the age cheating mess has forced the rethink, Mukherjee said: "We have full faith in the AIFF. I would like to put it this way that a school tournament will give a Nicolai Adam or a Stephen Constantine more options to choose from."
Though the beverage giants are scheduled to have a meeting on October 8 with the AIFF to chalk out the format, it was learnt from insiders in the governing body that a ten-state proposal is being prepared starting from the district-level preliminary qualification in each state to the state round and finally the national leg where ten best schools from the ten states will vie for top honours.
"Top two teams from the zonals conducted in each state will play the state qualifier. From there the top team from every state will play in the national round. Coke is game for the format. We will have a formal meeting next Thursday," an AIFF official revealed.
Meanwhile, it was also learnt that Coca Cola are willing to sponsor the expansive scouting programme that the AIFF has set up of late.
"There will be more spotters watching the matches this time. We are also in talks with the AIFF to create an even more pervasive scouting platform," informed Mukherjee when asked about this development.
This, if materializes, will be the second nationwide inter-school tournament after Subroto Cup, which is conducted by Indian Air Force. The Mir Iqbal Trophy is under the aegis of AIFF, and this will be the first time a school meet will be organised by the governing body.
